isHierarchical().Description: Gets if the collection is a hierarchically ordered.

Parameters: boolean: Whether the collection is hierarchical.
int: The collection's selection mode, one of: SELECTION_MODE_NONE SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE
obtain(int, int, boolean, int).Description: Returns a cached instance if such is available otherwise a new one.
obtain(int, int, boolean, int).FullName: AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.CollectionInfoCompat obtain (int rowCount, int columnCount, boolean hierarchical, int selectionMode)

Returns: The collection's selection mode, one of: SELECTION_MODE_NONE SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE

ClassDesc: Class with information if a node is a collection. A collection of items has rows and columns and may be hierarchical. For example, a horizontal list is a collection with one column, as many rows as the list items, and is not hierarchical; A table is a collection with several rows, several columns, and is not hierarchical; A vertical tree is a hierarchical collection with one column and as many rows as the first level children.
